intro: Orchiodes, commonly known as the orchid genus, encompasses a diverse group of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their intricate, often showy flowers with three sepals, three petals, and a specialized structure called the labellum. Orchiodes species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Their roots are often mycorrhizal, forming symbiotic relationships with fungi to enhance nutrient absorption. The genus includes both terrestrial and epiphytic species, showcasing a wide range of morphological adaptations.
